title: Changing voiceline using a third party program
body: As some of you may know, LVOC - LoL VO Changer is a popular voice changing program that enables you to have korean voices over the one you have. I was wondering if this was bannable? It only changes the voices though. Thanks in advance.

replies.body:
AFAIK the only thing LVOC does is replace the voice files with the ones from other regions.  There is nothing to detect as malicious software.

Broporo is a Riot employee so he is forced to say that "3rd party software is bad mmmkay", but you should be safe.  Also voice actors have licenses or whatnot, so Riot can't publically support using "unlicensed" voicework outside of their "proper" region.

Consider that even in the false ban waves that went out a few times, none of the forum posters were banned for using LVOC.  I've been using it for about two years now with no problems.

Mm alright. So, even if I did get banned, I can do an appeal right since I'm not using anything that interferes with gameplay right?

This is gonna be pretty borderline. I'm right there with ya, I definitely prefer other languages when it comes to most of my games (100% jap voices almost 100% of the time). These kinds of programs do run the chance of being detected as malicious software though and could get your account banned AFAIK. I'd have to suggest not using this just to be safe.
